channel.title: Live Scores, Latest Sports News, Results, Cricket Updates | The Hindu
channel.description: Stay Up To Date With The Latest Sports News &amp; Updates From The World Of Cricket, Football, Tennis, Badminton &amp; Much More At The Hindu

image.title: Live Scores, Latest Sports News, Results, Cricket Updates | The Hindu

item.title: Mel Hussain takes strike again at ‘home away from home’
item.description: Born to an Indian father and English mother, Mel spent the formative years of his life in Chennai before his family shifted base to the United Kingdom

item.title: Pakistan delays decision on participation in T20 World Cup
item.description: Naqvi took to social media to confirm that the issue was discussed at length during his meeting on Monday with the Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif

item.title: Haryana Thunders on top of the table
Villoo C. Poonawalla Indian Derby on February 1
item.description: MUMBAI

item.title: Shambala, Buckingham, Enrich and Snow Girl catch the eye
Gavaskar gushes over India's depth ahead of T20 World Cup
item.description: Sunil Gavaskar underlined India's depth as India took an unassailable 3-0 lead in the five-match series with a scintillating eight-wicket win in Guwahati on January 25

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Jannik Sinner takes heat out of the equation, advances to quarterfinals
item.description: The two-time defending champion felt lucky to survive the third round but rebounded quickly in a straight-sets win over Italian Luciano Darderi

item.title: Tata Steel Masters: Gukesh slumps to another defeat against Giri
item.description: On what turned out to be a tough day for Indians, Arjun Erigaisi found himself on the receiving end against Yagiz Kaan Erdogmus of Turkiye who played a remarkable game to beat the world No. 5 and the top seeded

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Defending champion Madison Keys knocked out by Jessica Pegula
item.description: Pegula reached the U.S. Open final in 2024 but lost to Aryna Sabalenka. It will be her fourth appearance in the quarterfinals in Australia

item.title: Relentless Saina pushes limits, shows the way for Gen Next
item.description: The badminton ace bows out of the international aren aon her own terms after a storied career, whose seeds were sown at the Philippines Open in 2006; the 2012 London Olympics bronze medallist held the door open long enough for others to walk in

item.title: HIL: Boon’s ’trick powers Royals into the final
Ranji Trophy: Rasheed’s unbeaten ton scripts Andhra’s emphatic win over Vidarbha
item.description: Skipper Bhui and Bharat chip in with vital contributions as the hosts make the most of th efriendly batting conditions to ace a clinical chase against Vidarbha and top Group-A

item.title: Saransh and Solanki the stars in MP’s resounding win
Ranji Trophy: Bowlers seal it for Tamil Nadu’s first victory of the season
IND vs NZ 3rd T20I: After the Bs sting Kiwis, Abhishek takes over
item.description: Bumrah and Bishnoi deliver telling spells to restrict the visitors; the belligerent opener, in the company of skipper Suryakumar, then propels the Men in Blue home with 10 overs to spare

item.title: Ranji Trophy: Sai Kishore highlights the need to build on the win over Odisha
item.description: Says Sonu Yadav’s performance was an out-and-out match-winning one

item.title: Disappointed at missing the chance to force innings win, says Siddhesh Lad
MOTORSPORTS | Teenagers Ishaan and Sai Shiva rule the roost
Mumbai beats Hyderabad, seals spot in the knockouts
item.description: Milind leads a lower-order riposte as home team fights back to avoid innings defeat; shares half-century partnerships with Nitin and Siraj; Musheer scalps five wickets

item.title: CRICKET | Thought my chance with India had gone, says Bharti after Oz tour recall
Stormy Sea and Diego Garcia show out
Australian Open 2026: Novak Djokovic into quarterfinals after Mensik pullout
item.description: Djokovic, the ​10-times Australian Open champion, will continue his quest ⁠for a 25th Grand Slam crown to surpass the record he currently shares with ​Margaret Court

item.title: ICC T20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan drops Haris Rauf from the squad
item.description: Shaheen Shah Afridi was declared fit and included in the squad with Naseem Shah and relatively inexperienced Salman Mirza the other fast bowlers

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Carlos Alcaraz eases into last eight in bid for maiden Melbourne title
item.description: The six-time Grand Slam champion won 7-6 (8/6), 6-4, 7-5 to equal his best run in Melbourne and is yet to drop a set

item.title: Bangladesh’s absence from T20 World Cup a sad moment for the game: World Cricketers' Association
item.description: Rather than allowing division or exclusion to take ‌hold, we call on the game’s leaders to work ‌with all stakeholders, including Governing Bodies, leagues and players, to unite the sport, not divide it..., says World Cricketers' Association (WCA) chief executive Tom Moffat

item.title: Bangladesh Cricket Board reopens door for star player Shakib Al Hasan
item.description: The all-rounder announced his retirement from international cricket in 2024, but said he would like to reverse that decision last month

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Aryna Sabalenka holds off next-gen talent Mboko to reach quarterfinals
item.description: Twice champion Sabalenka crushed Mboko in ‌a 31-minute first set in the early match ​at Rod Laver Arena but gave up a 4-1 lead in the second as the 17th seed mounted an impressive comeback

item.title: Grateful to ICC for T20 World Cup invite, preparing to arrive in India immediately: Cricket Scotland CEO
item.description: Scotland, however, will need some time to announce their 15-member squad for the tournament which begins on February 7.

item.title: Pro Wrestling League: Amit stars as Maharashtra Kesari jumps to top spot in PWL
item.description: Amit’s victory led Maharashtra Kesari to defeat Haryana Thunders 5-4, topping the Pro Wrestling League.

item.title: WPL | DC puts an end to RCB’s winning streak
item.description: Nandani leads a spirited bowling effort to bundle out the Bengaluru side for 109; the Delhi outfit chases down the target with 26 balls to spare

item.title: Kalinga Stadium turns into a training ground for Asian Indoor meet athletes
Ranji Trophy: Himanshu shows the way as MP bats Karnataka out of the contest
item.description: The visiting team grabs an overall lead of 336 runs with four wickets in hand going into the final day; the host gets bowled out for 191 in its first essay

item.title: Ranji Trophy: Hyderabad stares down the barrel as Mumbai closes in on innings victory
item.description: The home team ends the penultimate day 127 runs in arrears with only three wickets left; Mohit and Musheer scalp three each in the second essay

item.title: Ranji Trophy | Adapting and reinventing help Athish step up his game
item.description: The Tamil Nadu batter says he closely studies videos of Usman Khawaja’s batting

item.title: Ranji Trophy | Sarfaraz deserves another chance to play for India: Mohammad Azharuddin
item.description: “At the end of the day, he went and played. He scored those runs, and he should take all the accolades. I am very thankful that he took my name, but it was not required.”

item.title: TABLE TENNIS | Bhavina has planned an extensive overseas schedule
item.description: The Tokyo Paralympics silver medallist will take part in 12 international events in a year which will feature the Asian Para Games in Japan and the World Championships in Thailand

item.title: MOTORSPORTS | Commanding wins for Ishaan Madesh and Nigel Abraham Thomas
Ranji Trophy | Athish and Sonu take the game away from Odisha
item.description: The opener’s 88 and the speedster’s 74 help Tamil Nadu score 316 in its second innings; Badal scalps a three-for; the host, chasing a mammoth 455, reaches 47 for two at the end of day three

item.title: Calmer, stronger, more determined: Susaki targets LA to regain Olympic title
item.description: Japanese wrestling legend is undecided on her category but firm in her ambition to prove herself; eager for a rematch with Vinesh

item.title: Innings win over Kerala ‘massive’, says Chandigarh captain Manan Vohra
Ranji Trophy: Chandigarh wraps up innings win well inside three days
item.description: Rohit claims four while Vishu scalps three as Kerala folds up for 185 in 48 overs; Vishnu and Salman’s contrasting half-centuries to no avail

item.title: PCB chief Naqvi says Pakistan govt will decide on T20 World Cup participation after Bangladesh exit
item.description: Our PM (Shahbaz Sharif) is out of the country. When he comes, we will take advice from him. The decision by the government will be final and binding, and if they say no, then they (ICC) may invite any other team, says PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi

item.title: Hockey | Manpreet shuts out the noise of him being past his prime
item.description: The double Olympic medallist has kept himself fighting fit, focussed on his gym work and has been playing well for Ranchi Royals in the HIL

item.title: IND vs NZ 3rd T20I Preview | Red-hot India sets sights on yet another T20I series triumph
item.description: Suryakumar Yadav’s men produced dominant victories in Nagpur and Raipur and now have set their sights on wrapping up the five-match rubber. The Men in Blue are hitting their stride at the right moment.

item.title: HIL | Royals take on Toofans in Qualifier 2
Djokovic wins record 400th Slam match to power on in Australia
item.description: The 38-year-old Serbian great swept past Dutchman Botic van de Zandschulp 6-3, 6-4, 7-6 (7/4) under a closed roof on centre court to extend his own all-time record of match wins at the majors

item.title: Buckingham and Mansa Musa showed out
T20 World Cup 2026: Scotland to replace Bangladesh, confirms ICC
item.description: Scotland will thus play their four group league games against West Indies (February 7), Italy (February 9) and England (February 14) in Kolkata followed by a game against Nepal in Mumbai on February 17

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Naomi Osaka withdraws before third-round match
item.description: The two-time Australian Open champion announced it on social media without divulging her injury, posting on Instagram that she had to withdraw “to address something my body needs attention for after my last match

item.title: Shivam Dube says Suryakumar Yadav showed why he’s the best, lavishes praise on Ishan Kishan
item.description: Kiwi batter Rachin Ravindra gave credit to Kishan and Suryakumar for helping the Men in Blue ace the 209-run chase

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Jannik Sinner battles cramp, heat to reach fourth round
item.description: The Italian limped over to his players' box in desperation ​midway through the match and was told by coach Darren Cahill to walk through the rest of the third set if necessary to get to a break

item.title: Pratika Rawal, Vaishnavi Sharma, Kranti Gaud in India’s Women Test squad to face Australia
item.description: The 15-member squad will be led by Harmanpreet Kaur, and the Test will follow the white ball format matches (3 T20Is, 3 ODIs), beginning from February 15

item.title: Ota Zaremba, 1980 Olympic weightlifting champion who spoke out about doping, dies at 68
item.description: Ota Zaremba who won a weightlifting gold medal at the 1980 Moscow Olympics before admitting to using performance-enhancing drugs, has died

item.title: Time to consider World Cup boycott over Trump’s actions, says German football official
item.description: Oke Göttlich is likely to face resistance to a boycott from federation president Bernd Neuendorf and FIFA president Gianni Infantino

item.title: FIFA to award $2.3 million to winners of inaugural Women’s Champions Cup
item.description: The total fund detailed by FIFA will share $3.9 million among the six continental champions

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Extreme heat triggers suspension rule at baking Melbourne
item.description: The tournament has a Heat Stress Scale of 1-5, with five the highest. It hit five in the early afternoon, when it was about 36C, prompting the suspension

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Madison Keys revels in Melbourne heat as Novak Djokovic steps up history bid
item.description: Players, fans and tournament organisers are braced for highs of 40C in the late afternoon, which could see play suspended

item.title: Sri Lanka gets the better of England in the opening ODI
item.description: England overcame the early loss of Zak Crawley, who made a disappointing return to 50-over format after more than two years when he nicked Asitha Fernando behind wickets after scoring just 6 runs in his comeback game

item.title: Kyle Jamieson replaces injured Adam Milne in New Zealand squad for T20 World Cup
item.description: New Zealand head coach Rob Walter said Milne, who wasn’t a part of the squad touring India, was getting himself ready for the T20 World Cup

item.title: Fear of failure might have crept into all of us: Rohit on 13-year ICC title drought
item.description: The former captain, who currently plays in the ODIs only, said the team management headlined by him and former head coach Rahul Dravid wanted to remove the fear by giving everyone freedom and clarity in their roles

item.title: Sindhu, Lakshya lose in quarterfinals; Indian challenge ends in Indonesia Masters
item.description: Sindhu, a two-time Olympic medallist, lost to top seed and world number four Chen Yu Fei of China 13-21 17-21 in the quarterfinal contest that lasted 42 minutes to bow out of the Super 500 event

item.title: Mane, Sakshi better national record scores in air rifle trials
item.description: Sakshi shot 254.3 in the T2 final while Shahu Tushar Mane scored 637.1 in the qualification. Both these scores are better than the national record but they will not enter the official record books

item.title: Pakistan selectors include Shaheen Afridi for series against Australia
item.description: Afridi had injured his knee while fielding during the Big Bash League in Australia and returned home for treatment at the high performance centre in Lahore

item.title: Placed in Pool B, India begins campaign against Uruguay on March 8 in FIH Women's WC qualifiers
item.description: The semifinals will be played on March 13 while the third-place playoff and the final will be held on March 14

item.title: Bangladesh appeal can't be heard by ICC's DRC; Scotland to be named as replacement by January 24
item.description: Even as the ICC has kept Scotland on stand-by, the BCB under Aminul Islam Bulbul, after being completely cornered, decided to use its last resort — approach the DRC headed by Englishman Michael Beloff (Kings Counsel)

item.title: At four, I watched Kosteniuk become World champion; I felt I needed that crown: Assaubayeva
item.description: The youngest woman to claim the World Blitz Championship, Assaubayeva has ambitions of winning the prestigious classical title. In this chat, she talks about her beginnings in chess, what achieving the GM title meant to her, why she enjoys playing in India, what she thinks of D. Gukesh and Arjun Erigiaisi, and where Kazakhstan chess is headed

item.title: HIL Men - Lancers book final berth; Royals and Toofans to fight for the other spot
No-limits Mahuchikh looks to reassert her aerial dominance
item.description: The Ukrainian high jumper has begun 2026 with her best clearance since setting the world record in 2024. This bodes well for the reigning Olympic champion, who had a disappointing end to 2025, losing her World title and being outshone by rival Nicola Olyslagers. Mahuchikh’s eyes this year are set firmly on making March’s World Indoor Championships her own

item.title: Mudgway dominates inaugural Pune Grand Tour; crowned overall winner
Ranji Trophy | Saurashtra drubs Punjab inside two days
item.description: Valuable contributions from the lower-order, led by Jadeja and Prerak, put the target beyond the visitor’s reach before home spinners Dharmendra and Bhut claim five each to bundle out Gill & Co. for 125 in just 39 overs; left-arm tweaker Harpreet’s 11-wicket match haul goes in vain

item.title: Ranji Trophy | Arjun and Vohra pile on Kerala’s misery
item.description: The top-order batters hammer centuries as Chandigarh move closer to its first victory of the season after securing 277-run first-innings lead; speedster Eden scalps a four-wicket haul for the home team; host down in the dumps, losing two wickets for 21 in its second essay

item.title: Sarfaraz credits Azharuddin for success on a tough wicket
Our batters have to adapt to lower bounce: Warriorz’ skipper Lanning
Ranji Trophy: Sarfaraz’s double ton helps Mumbai extend domination
item.description: The middle-order batter braves a wrist injury and puts on 154 for the sixth wicket with Suved as the visitor ends up with a mammoth total of 560; Rahul and Himateja’s unbroken 100-run stand lifts Hyderabad to 138 for two

item.title: RANJI TROPHY | It wasn’t a two-day pitch, says Saurashtra coach Odedra
Ranji Trophy | Mumbai’s Atharva Ankolekar to be out for four to six weeks
item.description: Atharva Ankolekar was a last-minute replacement for left-arm spinner Shams Mulani, who picked up an injury and had to fly back to Mumbai for further tests

item.title: Ranji Trophy: Shoddy batting display leaves Karnataka in a precarious position
item.description: The home team ends the second day on 168 for eight, trailing Madhya Pradesh by 155 runs; opener Aneesh stands tall amid the ruins with an unbeaten 80; off-spinner Saransh claims a three-for

item.title: IND vs NZ 2nd T20I | Kishan, Suryakumar make it a cakewalk for Men in Blue
item.description: The two add 122 off just 48 balls after the early dismissals of the openers to take the game away from the Kiwis; Dube chips in with a cameo as the host chases down 209 with consummate ease

item.title: Ranji Trophy: Sonu’s maiden five-wicket haul puts Tamil Nadu in the driver’s seat
item.description: The visitor, which gains a first-innings lead of 138, extends it to 164 with nine wickets in hand at stumps on day two; Parida and Baral offer some fight for the host

item.title: RANJI TROPHY | Vidarbha gets its nose in front after a frenetic second day’s play
item.description: CRICKET | Andhra falls short of the visitor’s total to hand the advantage to the rival; Abhishek continues with his fine form with a fluent half-century while Saurabh lends support with fighting knock

item.title: Gaganjeet Bhullar rues lack of depth, hunger in Indian golf
Social Butterfly, Fynbos and Zacharias catch the eye
Daily Quiz: On Africa’s prestigious tournament
item.description: Senegal won this year’s African Cup of Nations beating hosts Morocco on January 18, 2026

item.title: Chess GM Daniel Naroditsky died after cardiac issue, report says
item.description: A toxicology report ruled the 29-year-old’s death an accident; the examiner’s report noted the cheating allegations weeks before his death had caused Naroditsky stress

item.title: Australian Open 2026: A meeting of experience and youth — Sabalenka set to play Mboko
item.description: When the top-ranked player in women's tennis meets one of the sport's rising teenage stars, though, it'll be all about the business of tennis

item.title: Australian Open to start earlier on Jan. 24 over forecast 40C heat
item.description: Play will start in Melbourne at 10:30 a.m. on the main arenas, compared to the normal 11:00 or 11:30 a.m.

item.title: Casemiro to leave Manchester United after 2025-26 season
item.description: The Brazilian arrived at Old Trafford in August 2022 from Real Madrid for a fee of around $80.90 million

item.title: Australia Open 2026: Carlos Alcaraz celebrates 100th Slam match with easy win
item.description: The 22-year-old six-time major winner was at a different level on Rod Laver Arena to book his passage 6-2, 6-4, 6-1 in 2hrs 5mins

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Sabalenka passes Potapova test to reach fourth round; Alcaraz sets sights on last 16
item.description: Seemingly down and out at ​4-0 in the second set, the world ⁠number 55 broke Sabalenka three times and nudged ahead to 6-5, forcing the Belarusian into a surprising scrap to the ​finish

item.title: Liverpool cruise as Bayern reach Champions League last 16
item.description: Bayern joined table-toppers Arsenal in guaranteeing a top-eight finish with a game to spare, and therefore a last-16 spot, as they saw off the Belgian champions at the Allianz Arena

item.title: Adar Poonawalla to make 'strong and competitive' bid for RCB
item.description: Royal Challengers are the defending IPL champions and, perhaps, have the biggest fan base among the 10 teams in the league

item.title: Tilottama tops 10m Air Rifle Women trials; Mane, Sidhu too win
item.description: Shahu Tushar Mane of Railways won in the men's event, while Vijayveer Sidhu claimed top spot in 25m Rapid Fire Pistol T2 at the Dr. Karni Singh Shooting Range

item.title: Former India defender Ilyas Pasha dead, AIFF, East Bengal condole
item.description: A committed and soft-spoken footballer, Pasha carved out a distinguished career in an area of the field that demanded resilience and composure — defence

item.title: Rickelton, Stubbs replace injured De Zorzi, Ferreira in SA squad for T20 World Cup
item.description: Both De Zorzi and Ferreira are also ruled out of Proteas’ three-match home T20I series against the West Indies

item.title: Harshita stars for Maharashtra Kesari
item.description: With both teams tied on four points, Maharashtra Kesari, who won the tie 5-4, moved to second on the table with 14 bout wins behind UP Dominators, who have won 20 bouts

item.title: Tata Steel Masters: Gukesh beats Nguyen; Arjun shocked by Fedoseev
item.description: Gukesh's timely victory ahead of the first rest day on Thursday (January 22, 2026) put him on three points out of a possible five and the Indian ace went up to joint fourth spot behind three leaders

item.title: No immediate threat, but Gambhir under scrutiny
item.description: Coaches are ranked on the basis of what their outfits achieve in terms of victories and silverware. In his year and a half in charge, the spunky former opener has had reasonable trysts with both these necessities, but has also courted a fair amount of failure, some of which the pundits have attributed to a lack of consistency in team selection

item.title: WPL-4: Devine’s all-round skills to the fore as Giants wallop Warriorz
item.description: The Kiwi all-rounder scores an unbeaten 50 off 42 balls to lift the Gujarat side to 153 on a slow track and follows it up with a couple of wickets; Rajeshwari runs through the lower middle-order as the UP side folds up for 108

item.title: Ranji Trophy | Centuries by Sarfaraz, Lad put Mumbai in command against Hyderabad
item.description: The former brings up his 17th First Class century, while the latter capitalises on a dropped catch from Nitish

item.title: Men’s HIL | Soorma’s 6-1 victory not enough for a playoff spot
item.description: Soorma, needing a win by seven clear goals to displace HIL GC from the fourth spot, were tied with Hyderabad Toofans and HIL GC on 11 points but finished agonisingly fifth
